poem:
Title: "In the Echo of a Fizzled Fandom"

A note struck on the strings of youth,  
enamored by the rhapsody of voices in bloom.   
A fervor, momentous, then translucent,  
unspooled like an old cassette tape.  
Why, with what tender lullaby  
did it fizzle into mere echo?  
The songs are the same,  
but the ears aged,  
and the heart lost tune.
